sentence.Network_en: It is inescapably clear that they won't turn round.
sentence.Network_cn: 显而易见，他们不会改变主意。

sentence.Network_en: A community - type, as a class - concept, is inescapably an abstraction.
sentence.Network_cn: 群落类型, 作为一个阶级概念, 无疑也是一种抽象.

sentence.Network_en: Early Christians thought marriage was inescapably tainted by the presence of sex.
sentence.Network_cn: 早期基督教徒认为,婚姻受到性爱的污染.

PerfectNetExp.abs: inescapable 逃不掉的inescapably 逃不掉地inesculent 不可吃的

list.abs: 不可避免的后果 inescapable consequences 必然的结果 inevitable result9 我同意。I agree. 我们同意 We agree to this plan. 我同意你的意见/你说的没错。You.
沪江词库精选inescapable cost是什么意思、英语短语。inescapable cost的意思是: 必然发生的成本相关短语:  inescapable cost 必然发生的成本  inescapable accident.
inefficient capital market无效能资本市场inescapable cost不可避免成本-
剑桥少儿英语（第三级下） ... harp 竖琴 inescapable responsibility 不可推卸的责任 heart 心；心脏.
像春节（the Spring Festival）这么劲爆的传统节日，好像没有什么讲的得通的道理，“回家过年”就是硬道理（ inescapable truth）。

entry.tran: 不容忽视的;不可避免的;必然发生的
entry.def: If you describe a fact, situation, or activity as inescapable, you mean that it is difficult not to notice it or be affected by it.

example.ex: The economic logic of reform is inescapable...
example.tran: 改革有其必然的经济学逻辑。

example.ex: A sense of imminent doom was inescapable.
example.tran: 一种即将来临的毁灭感无可逃避。

sentences.sentence: "the new council was inescapably of political meaning"

auth_sentence.content: My fifth and final lesson derives inescapably from those other four.
auth_sentence.res_content: My fifth and final lesson derives inescapably from those other four.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My fifth and final lesson derives inescapably from those other four.

auth_sentence.content: The idea of free will is complicated further by its inescapably subjective nature and the difficulty of defining it precisely.
auth_sentence.res_content: The idea of free will is complicated further by its inescapably subjective nature and the difficulty of defining it precisely.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The idea of free will is complicated further by its inescapably subjective nature and the difficulty of defining it precisely.

auth_sentence.content: My assertion that everyone is inherently and as a Rule inescapably biased, is not 'new' at all.
auth_sentence.res_content: My assertion that everyone is inherently and as a Rule inescapably biased, is not 'new' at all.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My assertion that everyone is inherently and as a Rule inescapably biased, is not 'new' at all.
